quote: A U-Net consists of two convolutional networks an encoder or feature extraction network and a decoder or localization network.
we hypothesized that both global and local features are required to make voxel-wise predictions.
The CNN encoder and Implicit decoder networks are trained simultaneously end-to-end.
Implicit U-Net achieves comparable performance to U-Net in both datasets.
Our experiments show that our method achieves competitive results when compared to the reference architecture for this task (i.e. the 3D U-Net) while improving training and inference times by 30%.
Faster inference makes Implicit U-Net relevant in the current practice dealing with larger datasets, larger image sizes and for hospitals and companies running actual segmentation tasks.
We propose Implicit U-Net in the context of growing research interest to improve U-Net architecture replacing some of the computationally expensive 3D convolutions
